SENT.plain: Cholesterol is considered a risk factor in vascular dementia as well as in Alzheimer's disease
Several biochemical, epidemiological and genetic aspects established a correlation between cholesterol concentration and Alzheimer's disease

Microglia activation, astrocytosis with metallothionein-I-II overexpression, amyloid beta intraneuronal accumulation and a rare formation of amyloid beta extracellular positive deposits were the major immunohistochemical features observed in the brain of high cholesterol-fed animals
The relevance on the cholesterol metabolism in Alzheimer's disease pathogenesis is also discussed
